3.186. 
Obligations of parents in the management of the property of minor children 
1. Parents are obliged to manage their minor children's property solely in the interests of the children. 
2. The parents may use the income and fruits of the property belonging to the minor child for family purposes, taking into account the best interests of the child. 
3. The parents who manage the property of the minor child shall not have the right to acquire, directly or through intermediaries, the property or the rights thereto in their own possession. This provision shall also apply in the case of the sale by auction of the minor's property or of the rights thereto. An action for annulment of such transactions may be brought by the child or his or her heirs. 
4. The parents of a minor child are prohibited from concluding an assignment of claims agreement whereby they acquire a right of claim over their minor child's property or rights.
